alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Nacogdoches; Panola; Rusk; Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 3:28AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SMITH...SOUTHWESTERN PANOLA...RUSK...NORTHWESTERN NACOGDOCHES AND CHEROKEE COUNTIES THROUGH 430 AM CDT... At 328 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Whitehouse to near Mixon to near Reese to 11 miles south of Frankston to near Palestine. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tyler, Jacksonville, Henderson, Whitehouse, Rusk, Overton, Bullard, Troup, Alto, New London, Arp, Beckville, Morrill, Ponta, Pinehill, New Salem, Trawick, Mount Selman, Joinerville, and Sacul. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
